text:
have any of you watched any book-to-movie adaptations recently?❄️⛄️🎄
.
the other night, I finally watched the Netflix adaptation of Let it Snow, and although it was enjoyable, I just felt a bit meh about it🙁 I reread Let it Snow almost every single year, and have done for the last 5/6 years. it’s one of my favourite books, so I think because I know the book inside out, I had high expectations for the film. don’t get me wrong, it was super cute and if you haven’t read the book, I don’t think you’d think anything was amiss, but for me, it just wasn’t as quirky or feel as real as the book. 
.
I also watched the Netflix adaptation of Rebecca a few weeks ago, and it was enjoyable, but it just wasn’t as dark as I wanted it to be. the actors just didn’t seem to fit the roles, and I know I’m not alone in that opinion. if you separate the film from the book, I think it’s quite good, but I’m not sure if you’re adapting a book, that making the film worse is the goal😂
.
so although I’ve not had much luck with adaptations recently, it’s still really exciting to see a different take on your favourite books! do any of you have any favourite adaptations? for me, the Perks of Being a Wallflower is a complete standout. and also the 2005 film adaptation of Pride and Prejudice is just beautiful😊
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

-Bästa boken! Alltså på riktigt, bästa boken!

Let it snow är en underbar bok som jag hade kunnat läsa om hur många gånger som helst. Och bara gillat den ännu mer!❄️❄️🌟

Första delen handlar om Jubilee som fastnar med tåget mitt ute i snöstormen. Då hon vägrar att vara kvar och fira jul på en våffelrestaurang med cheerleaders, ger hon sig iväg med den främmande killen Stuart. 
Andra delen handlar om Tobin och hans två kompisar, JP och Greven, som ger sig ut i snöstormen med siktet inställt på potatisplättar och cheerleaders. 
Tredje delen handlar om Addie som har klantat till det rejält och nu lider av hjärtesorg. Kanske kan letandet av den försvunna minigrisen Gabriel skingra tankarna. 

Hur spännande?!❄️✨

#letitsnow #letitsnowbook #johngreen #maureenjohnson #julböcker #laurenmyracle

“𝑆𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑦 𝑔𝑖𝑟𝑙, 𝑖𝑡’𝑠 𝑛𝑜𝑡 𝑤ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑢𝑛𝑖𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑠𝑒 𝑔𝑖𝑣𝑒𝑠 𝑢𝑠 𝑡ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑚𝑎𝑡𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑠. 𝐼𝑡’𝑠 𝑤ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑤𝑒 𝑔𝑖𝑣𝑒 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑢𝑛𝑖𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑠𝑒.” ✨

Olá, malta! Finalmente terminei este livro que trago comigo desde o ano passado... 😅

❄️❄️❄️

3 histórias diferentes, a acontecerem ao mesmo tempo e na mesma cidade. 
Eu adorei adorei adorei essas histórias!!
Confesso que sempre que chegava ao fim de uma história eu queria que continuasse, mas quando na última história todas as personagens se conectam... achei tão giro!! 
Não conhecia as autoras, mas ambas têm uma escrita leve e divertida, super fácil de ler e de se gostar. 
O conto do John Green não poderia ser mais John Green do que já é! O escritor tem aquela maneira de escrever muito própria, impossível de não reconhecer. No entanto.... foi a história que demorei mais tempo a ler porque era muito repetitiva 🤷🏻‍♀️
Mas as personagens dele eram as mais divertidas e engraçadas, algo muito comum em todas as personagens do autor 😋
Fiquei cheia de vontade de estar num sítio onde nevasse MUUUITO.

É super fofinho, perfeito para ler nesta altura (natal já passou mas vocês percebem). Aquece-nos o coração e dá-nos imensa vontade de ou ir ao Starbucks ou de comer Waffles!!!

8/10⭐️

Já alguma vez leram algum livro que vos dava imensa vontade de comer/beber alguma coisa específica?? 

❄️❄️❄️

🎶Let It Snow, Let It Snow, Let It Snow🎶

I hope you all had a lovely Christmas!🤍
——————————————————
Let It Snow 

book review 

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
This was a harmless and a joyful Christmas read! 
I enjoyed all the three stories and I liked how they all collided at the end! 
It was nice that the stories were from teenagers pov so I really could relate to the opinions and feelings.
Overall my favourite story was “The Jubilee Express” by Maureen Johnson! 
 ——————————————————
Now I wish you happy Holidays and I’ll see you In my next post! <3

the category is: comfort reads 📚💗

i forgot to add six of crows here but i didn’t wanna retake the photo again because this one turned out really good lmaooo 🥲

what’s your comfort book/s and why?

🚨 BOOK REVIEW 🚨

Let It Snow by Maureen Johnson, John Green and Lauren Myracle
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Honestly, when I started the last story in this collection, I thought it was gonna be downgraded to a 3. I hated everything about Addie and the people around her. But then I realised that was kinda the point, and her journey was actually an enjoyable one, and that ending and the way everything tied back in together definitely brought it back up to a four.

I really enjoyed each of these stories for different reasons. The first was just so funny and so sweet, and the second was such a perfect middle ground with idiot kids being idiots.

I did, however, wanna address the casual use of the word “retarded” in story two and “spaz” in story three. They’re very typical of 2008 lingo (i hope to god it’s not typical of todays lingo but I honestly wouldn’t know), but I think it’s important to address that that’s NOT OKAY. It felt uncomfortable to read and it felt wrong for me to not address it in the review. This book is flawed (for more reasons than just those two words honestly). But I think it’s important to acknowledge flaws in something we enjoy.

❄️ BOOKS ON TOUR ❄️

It’s only September, but it feels like beginning to look a lot like Christmas. Today is my stop and taking part in the #booksontour by @bookandtonic to promote a new release. 

📘Let It Snow by Beth Moran
📅 30 August 2022
📸 @bookandtonic 

“I’d say that if your family taught me anything, it’s the value of authenticity.”

First book I’ve read to begin the countdown until Christmas season. It’s also the first time I’m introduced to this book written by Beth Moran. Since this has a family Christmas-y premise, I’m happy to give myself a try. So, just like the energy and enthusiasm of a kid when it comes to Christmas season, I felt the same excitement to read this book!

It’s a home-for-the-holidays book that captures the range of emotions tied into saving a family’s legacy in a small town, being true to yourself, finding your true love and trying to keep a family secret just for the sake to cherish every moment with the family. It was totally hilarious and a fun quick read. There were entertaining family curveballs, which had kept me hooked in the story.

The book also offered a “Hallmark holiday romance” vibe. The romance was a slow burn yet heartwarming in the end. The romantic relationship of Bea (a meteorologist) and Henry (an astrophysicist) was charming. I ended up to found myself rooting for both of them. 

Overall, this book could be a good choice for you to escape from the madness of holiday rush or planning during the most wonderful time of the year, Christmas. It is light humor and a feel good book to curl up with a warm blanket and a hot MUG of hot chocolate and lots of toast. Yes! A MUG! Take note of that. Trust me.

✨"Once you think a thought, it is extremely difficult to unthink it."

- Let It Snow

❄️The collection of three short stories in Let It Snow will leave you hankering for more and more.  In other words, this holiday romantic piece is a perfect pick for a wintery read, especially curling up with hot chocolate☺️ (But I read it during good summer days😁).

❄️Coming to the novel, it was very-well written and sorted accordingly. It is a lovely story of complete strangers and how their paths cross. Few sequences are so heart-warming, you end up reading again and again. 

❄️I enjoyed reading the stories as the lives of all the characters are entwined beautifully and how they were bought together at the last. 

🌸If you are looking for some light-hearted romance, then this one is for you. It is a fabulous young adult read!!

✨ B O O K • R E V I E W ✨ 

❄️ Let It Snow ❄️ - @johngreenwritesbooks @maureenjohnsonbooks @myraclegirl 
“Three Holiday Romances”

It’s Christmas Eve and Gracetown has been buried by snow. But the weather is more than just an inconvenience. When one girl unexpectedly steps off a stranded train, she sets off a series of life-changing events. Soon fourteen pumped-up cheerleaders will descend on the local Waffle House, the Duke’s DVD night will be rudely interrupted for a Twister mission, and a lovesick barista will determine the fate of a single teacup pig... As the three stories collide, strangers cross paths and romance blossoms with heart-warming consequences.

⭐️⭐️⭐️ - A lovely holiday romance book. The chapters are somewhat short which helps to keep wanting to read. I love how all the short stories are entwined with each other and this really becomes noticeable at the end of the last story. You really end up rooting for the individual characters and their stories !! Makes for a lovely Young Adult read.

•

✨2022 READING RECAP: BOOK 1✨

📖 Let It Snow
✍🏽 John Green
✍🏽 Maureen Johnson
✍🏽 Lauren Myracle
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

First of all…this was a fun and easy read! After reading other books with multiple storylines by multiple authors, I wasn’t too sure about it. But, the way these storylines crossed, was pretty impressive. It was always something slight or a minor character from the last section. With that said, there was one story about kids driving in the snow that was harder to connect with. I think I had my mom hat on while reading it. 😆 

Have you read this or watched the Netflix version? What did you think?

#jualbukusecond #bukupreloved #jualbukubekas #secondenglishbook #prelovedenglishbooks #jualletitsnow #letitsnowbook #johngreen #readylanjutbaca

[Romance Novel]
Rate - 3.7/5
Price - $16

A Christmas Eve snowstorm transforms one small town into a romantic haven, the kind you see only in movies. Well, kinda. After all, a cold and wet hike from a stranded train through the middle of nowhere would not normally end with a delicious kiss from a charming stranger. And no one would think that a trip to the Waffle House through four feet of snow would lead to love with an old friend. Or that the way back to true love begins with a painfully early morning shift at Starbucks. Thanks to three of today’s bestselling teen authors—John Green, Maureen Johnson, and Lauren Myracle—the magic of the holidays shines on these hilarious and charming interconnected tales of love, romance, and breathtaking kisses.

#letitsnow #letitsnowbook #awesomebooksplus
New home, new (old) shelves! Sharing our snow books after the blizzard this weekend! ❄️❄️❄️

Hejka, dziś przychodzę do was z recenzją książki "W śnieżną noc" autorstwa: Green John, Johnson Maureen, Myracle Lauren. Jest to zbiór trzech opowiadań w tematyce zimowej.

Akcja rozgrywa się w pewną wigilię, której towarzyszy ogromna burza śnieżna. Każde z opowiadań tutaj zawartych jest o czymś innym, chociaż wszystkie mają jeden wspólny temat, którym jest MIŁOŚĆ.

MIŁOŚĆ, do którego chłopaka, którego poznajesz przez przypadek, jadąc pociągiem daleko od swoich rodziców, którzy zostali aresztowani, ponieważ wdali się w bójkę o limitowany ceramiczny domek.

Miłość, którą czujesz do dziewczyny, którą znasz od dziecka i którą traktowałeś jak dobrego ziomka.

I na koniec Miłość do osoby, którą zdradziłeś przez głupią sprzeczkę. Na dodatek wszyscy do okola zaczynają Ci mówić, że jesteś zadufana w sobie i że nie myślisz o innych, więc postanowisz się zmienić.

Na końcu wszystkie te historie się ze sobą łącza w subtelny i magiczny sposób, który mi bardzo przypadł do gustu.

Jeżeli lubicie opowiadania, które dzieją się w jednej miejscowości i których bohaterowie pojawiają się w innych historiach, ta książka jest jak najbardziej dla was. Bardzo mi się podobała, jest naprawdę słodka i niewinna, czuć w niej bardzo mocno magię świąt co na pewno jest na plus. Najbardziej podobało mi się ostatnie opowiadanie, było idealnym zakończeniem książki i spięciem wszystkich wątków. Zawiodłam się niestety na opowiadaniu Johna Greena, było najkrótsze, mało rozwinięte i płaskie. Polecam ją na długie zimne wieczory, magiczne historie i relacje pomiędzy bohaterami na pewno rozpala wasze serca do czerwoności nawet w najzimniejszą noc.

#wśnieżnąnoc #letitsnow #letitsnowbook #johngreen #maureenjohnson #laurenmyracle #bookstagrampolska #book #bookphotography #bookstagrampl #bookstagramtopasja #booklover #books #bookstagrammer #booksbooksbooks #bookstagram📖 #bookstagram #booklove #bookaholic #ksiażka #ksiazkadobranawszystko #ksiazkowelove #książki #ksiazkimojamilosc #ksiazkoholizm #książkoholiczka #książka #książkoholik #książkimłodzieżowe  #ksiazkoholicy

QOTD - When was the last time you saw snow? For me, it's definitely been a couple years since it rarely snows where I live. 

Between Christmas and New Year’s I picked up this book since I meant to get to it before Christmas (but finals got in the way lol) and I thought it was an okay read. Let it Snow is a collection of three romance short stories by Maureen Johnson, John Green, and Lauren Myracle which all set in the same small town during a snowstorm. Overall I enjoyed how each story tied together, but since every author writes differently I enjoyed some stories more than the others. I loved Maureen Johnson’s The Jubilee Express which focused on Jubilee who walks off of her train that has stopped during a snowstorm and meets a stranger who she journeys through the snow and eventually falls in love with. I thought Jubilee was a really strong main character and loved her characterization and love story. My least favorite had to be Lauren Myracle’s The Patron Saint of Pigs in part because it focuses on the self centered main character Addie and her quick redemption arc when she picks up her friend’s teacup pig from a local pet store, sacrificing her dignity and comfort along the way. I just found the redemption arc a little bit too rushed and overall didn’t really see it as a romance, although I guess since she ends up with someone at the end of the story and learns to love herself it could be considered one. Overall though, I thought it was a pretty fun read, but didn’t enjoy all of the short stories equally.

Let it snow - kolme talvista rakkaustarinaa: Jubilee Express, Lumienkeli-ilmiö ja Sikojen suojeluspyhimys

Kirjailijat: Maureen Johnson, John Green, Lauren Myracle

Suomentaja: Inka Parpola, Helene Bützow, Kaisa Kattelus

Kustantamo: WSOY

Sivuja: 312

Genre: YA

Tässä kirjassa on tosiaan kolme rakkaustarinaa, jotka kaikki liittyvät talveen ja joulunaikaan. Kirja on odotellut vuoroaan kirjahyllyssä jo pari vuotta, joten päätin tarttua siihen nyt, kun ulkona näyttää vielä talviselta. En tiennyt etukäteen, että kirjan tarinat liittyvät toisiinsa. Lukemisen lomassa oli hauskaa tajuta, että novelleissa pyörii samoja henkilöitä ja tapahtumia. Mielestäni tarinat kietoutuivat kivasti yhteen!

Tykkäsin ensimmäisestä novellista tosi paljon (Jubilee Express). Johnsonin kirjoitustyyli upposi muhun ja tarina oli virkistävän hauska. Haluan kyllä lukea lisää kyseisen kirjailijan kirjoja😍 

Lumienkeli-ilmiö ja Sikojen suojeluspyhimys puolestaan eivät oikeen olleet mun juttu. Ihan kivat tarinat, mutta en kuitenkaan päässyt niihin kiinni samalla tavalla kuin Jubilee Expressiin. Näiden kirjailijoiden huumori ei myöskään iskenyt muhun.

⭐️⭐️⭐️

📚 BLUE FRIENDSHIP STACK 📚

I have been tagged a while ago by @bookshelvesandtealeaves for the #bluestackforfriendship challenge.

There is a story behind this stack: when I wanted to take the picture, I have actually noticed to have just 3-4 blue cover books.
So what? It happened I bought some new and used books recently..yeah, I know, I did it again! 🤭
But, guess what? They had blue cover! I was finally ready to take the pic today! 🤭

💙 A genuine thanks to all my friends, the lifelong ones, the true and real ones, the new ones and the book community ones. 💙

Even though I haven’t read it I think it’s nice to show it off. I was planning to read it in December but I wasn’t in the mood to read it ;)

Ook al heb ik ‘let it snow’ niet gelezen, vind ik het wel leuk om hem op mijn feed te showen ;)

В чек-листе на декабрь был пункт про прочтение трёх книг с новогодним настроением. Одной из них стал сборник из трёх произведений Let it snow.
⠀
Книга отлично читается в оригинале, лексика довольно понятная, гуглить приходится минимально. Три прекрасных рождественских рассказа, пропитанных подростковой любовью, снегом и праздничным настроением. Рассказы написаны тремя разными авторами, но они переплетены между собой, и каждый заканчивается хэппи-эндом. Хотя, возможно, мне рассказы показались прекрасными как раз потому что они про Рождество и любовь, и книга попалась в самое подходящее для этого время (ну как попалась, она почти два года ждала своего часа и выдерживалась на полке😅).
⠀
Я бы рекомендовала читать эту книгу исключительно в декабре или в начале января для создания приятной праздничной атмосферы. И желательно на английском, чтоб узнать парочку новых слов 😃
⠀
Кстати, эту книгу мне подарила @os_xenia, заказывала на @myozby. Но сейчас я там не нахожу книг в оригинале… В связи с этим у меня возник вопрос: где у нас сейчас можно найти книги в оригинале? Не адаптированные, а именно оригинальные.

Happy Christmas! 🎄 If you celebrate I hope you have a lovely Christmas tomorrow. If not I hope you have a lovely relaxing day 💗

🎄Lets talk about Christmas books! 🎄

🎅🏽What’s your favorite Christmas book? 

I read Let it Snow in high school and was obsessed with it. So much so that I reread it every year in December for 3 years straight. I loved that it tells 3 different stories but everything comes together in the end. 
(Side note: don’t compare the book to the movie because I only needed to watch the trailer for the movie to know the adaptation was a disappointment 😂 Read the book!) 

Another Christmas book that I wanted to mention is 10 Blind Dates by Ashely Elston. I read this last year and became obsessed. I posted a review about it so I won’t say much but if you’re looking for a book about nosy family members, blind dates, romance, and one to give you all the Christmas feels...read it because you won’t be disappointed. ❤️
•

#christmas #christmasbooks #letitsnowbook #christmasreads #christmasread #bookstagram

Happy Monday! How much reading do you typically get each day? What will you be reading today?

I think usually, when I don't get much reading time, I get 30 minutes to an hour. There are some days I don't read at all, and then when I'm not busy and I spend a lot of the day reading, I read for 4 or 5 hours. 

I started Let It Snow by John Green, Maureen Johnson, and Lauren Myracle last night, and finished the first story, by Maureen Johnson. It was pretty good! I don't usually read holiday books around Christmas time, just continue with whatever fantasy book looks interesting. But I saw it at the used bookstore I went to the other day and decided I'd read it. 

I'm in a bit of a reading slump right now, so it's nice that I've found something enjoying to read.

Have a great day!

❄Van kedvenc karácsonyi könyveket?❄

A Hull a hó c. könyv 3 karácsonyi történetet tartalmaz, amely a végére összekapcsolódik egy nagy egésszé. Őszintén szólva engem sajnos nem nyert meg, mert meghitt karácsonyi hangulatot vártam tőle,amit nem kaptam meg. Igazából néhány tini szerelmi életéről szól,mellékes dolog hogy nagy hó van és egyébként karácsony.. 🙄 
John Greent ismertem a három író közül, de sajnos nekem az ő része sem tetszett különösebben.
Nem azt kaptam amit vártam,de ha ezt nem nézném valószínűleg aranyosnak tartanám. 
Viszont a borító igazi téli,jó hangulatú,így nem bánom hogy a polcom része lett.

❄Ti olvastátok esetleg ezt a könyvet? 

❄Megjegyezném, hogy a film viszont aranyos lett, ami a könyv alapján készült elvileg.

#book #bookstagram #booklover #ilovebioks #booknerd #bookworm #reader #readersofinstagram #librarybook #supportlibraries #kindle #ebook #christmasbooks  #christmasreads #christmasstories #achristmasmemory #letitsnow #letitsnowbook

⭐️⭐️ 🎄Want to get into the festive mood of Christmas? ❄️☃️❄️☃️ You may try this book. I was reading this years ago when I was much younger and figuring out the hype surrounding John Green’s writing. A young-adult book of three inter-connected holiday romances, I think ‘Let It Snow’ is generally heart-warming and fits nicely into the genre of hallmark-feel-good vibes of Christmas romances, but that’s about it. It’s rather bland and icky for me, and I don’t really like John Green even though I have read a few of his other titles. I tried re-reading this to see how I feel about it now and I still think a 2-star rating is quite a generous one 😅. I don’t want to be too much of a grinch about this so I would say I think the book can serve its purpose of getting its target audience into the festive christmassy winter vibes. I also just remembered that Netflix made this into a holiday movie already. 
.

Salut #bookstagram !

On se retrouve aujourd’hui pour parler d’un livre parfaitement adapté à la période actuelle : #floconsdamour de #johngreen #maureenjohnson et #laurenmyracle (aux éditions #hachette).

Ce livre génial compte trois histoires, certes différentes mais liées, sur des adolescents dans la ville de Gracetown le jour de Noël. 

Si vous aimez les histoires d’amour adolescentes, Noël, la « magie de Noël » et les situations improbables, ce livre vous plaire sûrement.

En tout cas je vous le recommande grandement. 
Perso, mon histoire préférée est celle de Maureen Johnson 😊

[si vous voulez un article plus complet, le lien de mon blog est dans ma bio]
